website_summaries.verdict: A great option for warmer climates with an elevated design that effectively keeps dogs cool and comfortable.
pros: Hammock-style construction with breathable mesh material promotes air circulation to keep dogs comfortable in hot weather
Overstuffed removable bolster offers a little extra security and acts as a comfy headrest
cons: With the bolster attached, it doesn't leave much room for dogs to stretch out

customer_reviews.title: Measure before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It's just unfortunate that the medium and large are such a big difference in size. Large was way too big for my pit and the mediums way too small (he's 80lbs). Pictured is the medium. We're sticking with the medium bc the large didn't fit in our living area. The biggest test is if our terrier can destroy this bed. So we'll get back to you if he does 👍
customer_reviews.author: ashlee petroski

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until..
customer_reviews.text: I loved the cot, until the seams started popping. First started with the pillow boarder, which was no big deal. Then the inside seam of the bolster completely came in done. The products description says it can hold 150 lbs and my dog is only 80 lbs. I'm very dissapointed, because until this happened I was very pleased with the cot.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure how my Olde English Bulldogge would like this bed
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how my Olde English Bulldogge would like this bed, but he absolutely loves it. It's easy to clean and very well put together. I will never buy a cushioned dog bed again. From now on, these raised beds will be the only way to go. My dog is 90lbs and fits perfectly in the medium sized bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great cot with or without the bolster and price is reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I like these cots from K&H, I have two without bolster and one with bolster. The material does break down over 6-8 months and needs to be replaced. Fortunately, you can find replacement pad for a reasonable price and do come on sale or add on for as low as $6. This way you can keep the cot frame and re use it again, have done this 3 time on one and 2 times on another. My dog 85-95#, is very happy with this outside or inside bed, especially in the heat because of ventilated material in the middle. He sometime uses it as a trampoline as he runs through the yard, he leaps on in and springs of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Outdoor Bed
customer_reviews.text: Our 11yo, 80lb husky/malamute, Kaia, absolutely LOVES this thing. I bought it as an outdoor bed to give her a more comfortable place to lay out on the patio and she took to it immediately. It seems as though the ability for air to flow freely underneath her helps keep her cool, which is always the goal with her breeds. We’ve had it about 10 months now, and it has exceeded every expectation. It spent the entirety of a Colorado winter outside and hasn’t skipped a beat. Absolutely thrilled with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Buckman

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 days...not chew proof/resistant
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this bed and it's chew resistant claims. As you can see from the picture, it's destroyed after 3 days. I knew the bunting wouldn't last (I laughed as I put it on saying sure, this will last - haha) but the mat and frame were toast too. If you have a chewer, don't bother with this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G

customer_reviews.title: Takoda Likes
customer_reviews.text: I asked Takoda if he likes his new bed - unfortunately he's to busy snoring, farting and sleeping on it to answer me...lol
customer_reviews.author: ReneJunito

customer_reviews.title: I like how light this is making it easy to move ...
customer_reviews.text: I like how light this is making it easy to move around the house. My dog is long and weighs 63lbs so we got the large and put a large, pillow-like, dog bed on top of it too to make it more comfortable and now she loves it more than the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: Yay she likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, mostly easy to assemble—no screws or anything which was nice. Seems durable but I may never know. Here’s a pic of my terrier mix lying beside it, as she has yet to embrace it. I guess it’s a lap or nothing for her. While I’m here, if you need a size reference, she’s around 20 lbs, allegedly a schnauzer-havanese mix (we have our doubts, she’s a pound pup rescue), fairly long torso ala dachshund. She’s lying next to this cot (by her tail), cot size medium. **Edit: see second pic. Just needed to give it another day.**
customer_reviews.author: love dogs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy design; dogs and cats use it.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these beds now. I have one large and one medium. All of my animals seems to like it. It was originally intended for my 70lb black lab but I often find up to all three of my cats in it. My golden retriever, 75lbs, fits in the large one but I haven't seen her try to get in the medium one. The medium one is in our bedroom and, typically, the dogs are in our bed with us. The surrounding bolster is the perfect addition because my dogs, most dogs probably, like to have their heads raised a little bit when they're lounging.
customer_reviews.author: goldngemgirl

customer_reviews.title: Its a winner!
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened the box my 75lb German Shepherd could not wait to lay on her bed. I bought the large size and it fits perfect for her. I also bought her a crate pillow to add extra pillow support which fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: NaNi

customer_reviews.title: It was nicely packaged. I opened the box and I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my package on time. It was nicely packaged. I opened the box and I was extremely impressed with this item on how nicely it was packaged. I put it togeather very quickly and my 80 pound senior dog is sleeping in it instead of my bed!!! Thank you!!! I have no regrets buying it. I would highly recommend it... I can easy move the bed from room to room.... He refused to sleep in any other dog bed. 😀😀
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: So Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to give the dogs a window view. As soon as I set it up they used it. My husband calls it a couch. A bought a pet bed in the same color to add more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I cannot tell you enough how well made this bed is... I bought it for our healer, to go to the kennel for a week, so I know he is off the floor. The pillow is what sold me.. My dog loves having his head on the pillow... Time will tell how it holds up to a week in a kennel, but I expect it will hold up better then the dog.. Excellent craftsmanship.. Thank you I bought the large
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Biggie approved, the best bed I ever bought,
customer_reviews.text: It supported my dogs weight of 90lbs, I was vet surprised, he loves his new bed, snuggles up in in comfortable and rest his head on the sides. It's a solid bed and great for the price, this is the first bed he hasn't chewed so that tells me he likes it as well as being very protective of it from my other pets.if he approved, so do I, I would definitely recommend the purchase of this bed to anyone. I call it the Biggie( that's his name) approved test, well worth the money,thank you for a great pruduct
customer_reviews.author: Annie cardel

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and ample weight capacity. The cushion on the sides is perfect for their heads to rest on. My 90 pound shepherd and 15 pound dachshund are very comfortable and right under the maximum weight capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Small dogs will love it!
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua loves this little outdoor bed! I also bought the “K&H Pet Products Pet Cot Canopy Small Tan 17” x 22” for $2.96 which I recommend you buy together. Its so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Avila

customer_reviews.title: Nice elevated bolster bed.
customer_reviews.text: My Border Collie didn’t care for the cot. I ordered a size up to 150 pounds, and he is 50 pounds. The cot is a clever idea. My dog did not use it at all. It’s easy to put together. It’s lightweight, so it would wobble just enough where he would not use it. Perhaps a dog that doesn’t mind climbing up onto a cot would love it. The bolster is an additional great thing. Sadly, my dog wouldn’t step up onto it. Amazon is great about accepting a return. The cot was put together and never used. I recommend it if your dog isn’t skittish about a bed on short legs.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Momma

customer_reviews.title: Made cheap
customer_reviews.text: Only had 2 weeks and the sticking came completely undone in the back. Very dissapointed as my dog loved this bed. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brea

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of this item. It was easy to put together. It is sturdy once put together. It is light weight. My girl is 20lbs and her back is 17inch in length and it has plenty of space even with a huge plush blanket on it. There are so many uses for this. I use it when I bring my girl to work so she wasn't on the cold floor. It also offers a bit of a "give" that the floor doesn't have, they way a cot would for a human sleeping. It would work for camping, again, for temperature control, as well keeping the obvious bugs away, and wetness on the ground. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: it was poorly made, the four sides were wonky, the pad did not stay in place, I threw it away. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Levine

customer_reviews.title: Not for larger dogs
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! At first I was pleased with the concept, dog off the ground, pillow for him to lean on, easy cleanup. That all changed after a few weeks of usage. Came home and opened his crate, noticed the bed leaning on the left side. Further inspection showed that the corner of the fabric were stitched was torn. Doesn’t appear to be repairable. Seems like a lot of money for a substandard product. The description says that it has a 200 pound capacity. Way over rated. Dog weighs 102 pounds. Might be fine for a lap dog but not one of any size. Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Axeldawg

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bed for my dog who was recently diagnosed with cancer so he could enjoy lounging in the sun without getting too hot (we live in Florida) and he's been making use of it every single day. I wasn't sure if he would even use it since it's so different from his other beds but he hopped right on and took to it instantly. It was super easy to put together but feels very sturdy and well-made. Overall, I would say this little bed is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble dog friendly
customer_reviews.text: We had to put my dogs favorite chair down and he was heart broken. We got this cot to replace his favorite chair. It took him a few days to warm up to the cot, and he still gives me the cold shoulder at least twice a day, but he now takes most of his naps on it. It's also much easier for our nine year old lab to get into and out of than his old chair.
customer_reviews.author: LT JT R

customer_reviews.title: Where else would you need them to keep your pet cool? Very disappointed in the quality of the fabric
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these in the chocolate color. 3 months later the bolsters have faded to an awful grey color. K & H customer service says they are not meant to be used in the sun. Where else would you need them to keep your pet cool? Very disappointed in the quality of the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: ADH

customer_reviews.title: Not for medium to big dogs
customer_reviews.text: Well this was a waste of money. We ordered the large for our 60 pound mutt based on other reviews that said it held up to 98lbs. and the first one we got didn't even last 24 hours before completely falling apart at the seams. They all just popped apart. Sent it back for another and blamed faulty stitching. The second one lasted about 2 weeks before doing the same thing. Into the trash it goes. Which is too bad because he really loved it for the 2 weeks he had it.
customer_reviews.author: Elevate Your Style

customer_reviews.title: Good pet bed, but for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: The dog seems to like it. One thing I've noticed after a couple of months of use is the surface that the dog lays on is starting to sink in a little like it's stretching. This is not a large dog (25-30 lbs), so that is concerning if it sinks anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie T

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: my doggie loves this! she likes to sleep with her head elevated and so this is perfect for her! She is a Blue Heeler at about 70lbs. so I bought the XL. easy to put together! easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Rebekahh Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Heaven Sent Dog Beds!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had these dog beds for several months now and they are like we got them! My dogs aren't chewers by nature but they do like to try to pull their beds out the dog doors (cushion ones without structure like these) and they like to pounce (and HARD!) on them. They have not had to be re-positioned, fixed or anything like that. The only thing they are is covered in hair and need a bath, lol. I would HIGHLY recommend them for rambunctious and rough dogs. THESE ARE PERFECTION. The only thing that could be better is if they were self-cleaning =)
customer_reviews.author: _Phaedra_

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and fast assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a more sturdy bed (less appealing chew toy) and came across the raised beds. I liked the look and price of this one plus it was same day delivery. I ordered the large because I have two 55 pound dogs and a Boston Terrier. The large did seem quite big, and was wondering if I should have ordered a medium. But it’s better to big bigger than not enough room. It was very easy to piece together and the quality is good. All 3 dogs took to it immediately and have enjoyed naps. I would definitely recommend this bed to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M

customer_reviews.title: Good but, not great
customer_reviews.text: Like many pet products, it depends on the dog whether it's good or bad. I had to teach my dog to sleep on it. I have a Husky so anything that keeps him cool is good. Honestly, my big Husky hated it but my regular size one loved it. Moving it kinda sucks because it wont keep its shape and the poles will move around. Besides the inconvenience of moving it around its held up pretty good after a year. Cleaning it with a Husky isn't easy without a rubber brush thing but it still takes me about 15 minutes to get the majority of the hair off. To sum it up, it's good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The bed is very lightweight, my dog seems to like it, and it seems to be pretty solid overall, but the reason for the 3 stars is because it's basically unusable indoors. Before I purchased I saw the reviews complaining about the noise, and I thought they were being dramatic, but it really is bad especially at night. When my dog (90 lbs) gets in/out of the bed it wakes me up, even from the other room. If you're a deep sleeper it may not be an issue for you, it doesn't bother my boyfriend, but if you're a light sleeper I wouldnt recommend for indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Received used item with hair all over it...
customer_reviews.text: The bed itself is ok....the bolstering is quite small - it's barely a bump let alone something your dog can lean on/against/or rest their head on. My opinion is that it is overpriced for what is it. The worst part is that Amazon sent a used item. Covered in hair from someone else/some other dog using it. Not appropriate and not professional for a company of their size and stature. What a waste of money........
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for a growing GSD.
customer_reviews.text: So far to date this has been a great investment. Our 16 week old GSD at 36.5 lbs fits perfect. She knows this is her bed and adjusted to it within 2 days. Would advise in winter time to add a dog pillow bed to the top since the airflow can keep them cooler in the colder nights adding the pillow bed keeps her warmer at night time. I would recommend this and I will be buying another for our standard aussie.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Butts

customer_reviews.title: Best pet purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this! She likes to be outside but doesn’t like to lay in the grass or the pavement so she doesn’t really “relax” outside. I originally ordered this for camping trips but I put it out in the backyard for her when we are outside so she has a spot to sit too, she loves it. Easy to put together and it seems to be very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: MorganTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to put together and move
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BED!!!!! I have a female Great Dane that weighs in between 115 and 120. She fit perfectly on it. She was so excited she tried getting on the bed while putting it together. Super easy to put together and it’s light so you can move it anywhere in the house. If you do buy this bed I would recommend to purchase the pad that goes with it. Makes the bed more comfortable ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Katie Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Great little bed!
customer_reviews.text: My little Frank is 15+ years old and he enjoys a good nap. I wanted something that would get him off the ground for good air circulation on hot days this looked like just the ticket, plus the bolsters looked good to rest his head on. Boy, what a great buy! He didn’t quite know what to think about it at first, I think because of the canopy, but he got over it really quickly and loves snoozing in his little bed. I think it’s pretty ergonomic for the little guy and he’s always assured a cool shaded little spot just for him... if the cat isn’t in it, that is!
customer_reviews.author: Jess8888

customer_reviews.title: Seems popped hours after we got it
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had for even a full day yet and the seems on the corner are popped. I was so excited about getting this for our dog. Based on the reviews, I thought it was worth buying. I don’t think I have ever been so disappointed with a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great bed, improved design
customer_reviews.text: I already had a larger K&H bed and needed a medium sized one for my dogs who are smaller. I like that the legs go straight down as opposed to my other bed that curved out and took up a larger footprint on the floor. The added cushion is a nice enhancement and I wish it was available for my other bed. Both my dogs have climbed into this bed and quickly fall asleep. The larger dog is 45-lbs, a basset/pit bull/Boston terrier, German Shorthaired Pointer mix and she fits comfortably on it. I do add a small blanket for extra comfort but it's not necessary. The suspension design is great.
customer_reviews.author: SnayKize

customer_reviews.title: Its A Keeper !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love this bed I always use this type of elevated bed for my deck and dog kennel This one with the sides I will be ordering again for sure I have 7 Chinese Crested who love to snuggle together on one bed I bought the large use it now in my Living room for them and transfer out the door on my deck when needed there Great for the Summer but I think this will be replacing their cloth bed I usually use inside and eventually the plain cots I now have outside in their Kennel Make sure you keep these in stock K&H I will be a repeat buyer !!!!
customer_reviews.author: dml

customer_reviews.title: Love this bolster trampoline bed.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of trampoline beds. I have a farm and 6 dogs and they all love theirs. I usually buy a bed and put it on that trampoline. I can clean under it easily and it provide airflow. This bolster trampoline is the best thing yet. I have included a picture of Byron on it. This is a small trampoline and Bryon is the size of a standard dachshund for reference. It’s much easier to wash a blanket instead of a bed but the bolster makes it similar to a bed and they love to rest their heads on it. I am planning on getting a couple more for my larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: MegW

customer_reviews.title: Durable and “big rowdy dog” approved
customer_reviews.text: These beds are great. I have had two of these beds for over a year and they’ve survived constant use and abuse by two large rowdy dogs. They are easy to wipe clean and still look brand new. I have a pitbull/French Mastiff mix and a GSD mix (both in the 80lb range) and they use these beds daily - they even cuddle up together and share one bed sometimes, which is “technically” over the recommended weight limit but hasn’t caused any problems at all in over a year of regular use. These beds were a solid buy and are 100% worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy or tough product
customer_reviews.text: My dog (70lb german shepherd) who I wouldn't describe normally as being terribly destructive was able to break through the cot on the first day he had it. I would not recommend this as a durable cot and would instead recommend spending the extra money to get a k9 ballistics or Kuranda cot for the better durability.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Sherlock is lovin’ it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 12-year old arthritic English bulldog loves this cot. Started out with one made by Coleman that folds up for ease of storage, but it kept collapsing because the joints don’t lock in place. This one takes a little longer to stow because it has to be assembled (no tools needed), but it stays together when a 70# dog jumps on and off. Wish we would have found this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: RockyMtnLvr

customer_reviews.title: The Dog ATE it
customer_reviews.text: I was so very surprised to find stuffing all over the dog's room when I returned from work. My Border Collie chewed the end off the bed roll and pulled out the stuffing less than 48 hours of putting them together. As this is designed for a large dog, I assumed the canvas would be a little more resistant to destruction. On the positive side, both dogs, my Catahoula Leopard and my Border Collie love the beds. They are very light weight, so easy to clean under. Easy to assemble and disassemble. Have not had to wash them yet, but look like they will be easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it for three season outdoor dog seating
customer_reviews.text: We have patio furniture; why not the dog? Can't say what long-term results will be in terms of cleaning and durability, but so far "Princess" loves her new throne/bed on the deck. We take it in in the heavy rain. I am initially impressed with the ingenuity and quality And ease of assembly. The raised mesh bottom lets the air flow and keeps Fido off the dirty ground. The bolster (a.k.a. puppy pillow) has zippers for cushion removal. I wouldn't leave it out in high winds. Works indoors too.
customer_reviews.author: LBK

customer_reviews.title: Love this outdoor pet bed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the small bed. My Buddy and Jack are about 20lbs each. When out on Lanai, they love this bed. (We have two beds)
customer_reviews.author: K Ioco

customer_reviews.title: A good bed, but the edge cushion is poorly attached
customer_reviews.text: A good dog bed, our 65# pit bull loves it. He's always on it when were in that room. We paid extra for the cushion on three sides, but it is not attached well. It's held ok by one little piece of nylon webbing and a few stitches. Not even a bar tack. So in the first week one side was falling off. A few months in and it hasn't gotten any worse, but a heavy chewer or nervous dog could destroy it in short order.
customer_reviews.author: TK421

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE  Dogs Love Em RIP in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Update Both our Rescue Dogs Love these beds. Bought 2 med for our Cocker & 2 large for our 50lb Husky. Both large cover seams fell apart. First the one in the pen & then the one in the house. The medium cots hold up fine even now with the Husky using one. We think the large needs a middle support or the sag in the middle causes the seams to separate. Will see how the medium holds up to the 50# Husky but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Martin

customer_reviews.title: Dog is pleased with her new throne
customer_reviews.text: My dog was a little nervous (as she is of most new things), but now she loves it! I bought the cooling gel pad made by the same company and it fits really well on this product and the dog also loves that too. She used to be spread out in the wood floor trying to cool off, now she just jumps on this bed and pad and snoozes the day away.

customer_reviews.title: Helped ease joint problems in 58 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bed for my 7 year old English Bulldog weighing 58 pounds he absolutely LOVES it. It's very easy for him to get in and he rests his face on the arms of it. Setup is very simple and the bed doesn't weigh alot if you will be moving it room to room like I do lol. Wherever he goes his bed goes with him. The center fabric reminds me of trampoline material, but about half the thickness which is awesome because he car get rough.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki_515

customer_reviews.title: BY FAR THE BEST DOG BEDS WE'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I had these dog best saved on my wish list for months before decided to just WING IT and buy them. Since I have two dogs I thought spending $100+ on beds was over budget. I can't even count how many beds they've destroyed over the years but these are worth it! I purchased two of the biggest size beds and they turned out bigger than I expected, I was worried my timberwolf mix wouldn't fit but he does with ROOM. For size, my dogs are 60-80 lbs. THEY BOTH LOVE THESE BEDS! BUY THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Powers

customer_reviews.title: Great but slightly wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but also easy to get a little wobble after assembly. I followed the instructions to a T and the legs were uneven afterward. It’s flexible, so all you have to do is twist the legs a bit to get it straight, but it’s annoying to have to do that every time. That being said, once my dog’s weight is on the bed it doesn’t seem to matter. She has taken many afternoon snoozes on the patio on this bed. Canvas fabric makes it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mb5431

customer_reviews.title: Cat abandoned me for this bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large one of this bed first for my dogs while they were outside and the never used it...but one of my cats was always on it. So I bought a small one for him to save on space on the deck and this cat legit sleeps on it every night and doesn’t sleep with us anymore! 😂 I mean, I’m happy he likes it so much, but I’d like some snuggles, ya know?! So yeah, dogs didn’t care for it, and now I don’t have a cat anymore!
customer_reviews.author: E. Morris

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought two one for outside and one for inside. Our pup really loves her bed. Much more comfortable then a hard floor. She loves the 3 side pillow, she is always using it. I love the breathable mess keeps it aird out, easy to rinse off with hose if needed, as well as keeps her cool in the summer and off the cold ground during the winter. Very well built and light weight. Complete win win for me all around. One year update: Starr is still loving it, she knows its heres and its her go to spot. Its still holding up and looking good. I'd recommend this to anyone. We did buy her another for outside too.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Duke LOVES his K&H bed!
customer_reviews.text: Duke is a 90 pound German Shepherd. Size Large bed with padded rails is more than big enough. I wanted to find a dog bed that Duke couldn't destroy. He chewed the corner of the padded rail just a little but that's okay because it's his bed. I also like this bed because it gets Duke up off the floor. He's been using this bed for over six months and it's very durable. Trust me when I say this bed has been "Duke" tested.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Medium size supports our 50+ pound lab easily!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great outdoor pupper bed for your patio and for camping. The medium size supports our 50+ pound lab mix easily, and can also be taken apart quickly for camping trips. It can keep your pupper cool on a hot day and if you throw a blanket on top it will kep them snug in the cooler hours. Super easy to clean and dry! Love this bed!
customer_reviews.author: Jbean

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this this morning so I’ll update after I’ve had it for awhile. I have a 65lbs Shepard mix and a 95lbs lab mix. Both fit on the large with some room to spare (not at the same time) when curled in a ball. They have another bed and they seem so far to prefer this one(like I said have only had it for about 3 hours). I like that it’s off the floor and the hair doesn’t seem to cling to it like my other. I can wipe it or vacuum it right off. I may purchase a second if this one proves to hold up. So far I’m very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bed is fine, but don’t spring for the bolster if your dog is a chewer
customer_reviews.text: Knowing that my dog (80 lb lab mix) is a chewer, I purchased this bed to put inside the large, insulated doghouse my son built for him. We already had a simple elevated bed (no bolster) for him to use on our deck, which he’s had for a few months and has not destroyed. I thought the bolster would be cozy for him. However, it only lasted a day or so before we came home to strewn bolster filling all over the yard. It was as if it were a challenge to him! The bed itself is still intact, but paying extra for the bolster was a waste of money, considering my dog’s propensity for chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it 4stars on being chew proof because my Pit is constantly laying on it but he licks and scratches it first. I am hoping this one lasts. My previous brand didn't make it through the summer before Midaz tore a whole in the mesh. He took to this right away and the size was perfect fit in his favorite outdoor sun spot. He cozies right in. I love watching him sleep on it...even heard him lightly snoring the other day...lol
customer_reviews.author: Pinklady1

customer_reviews.title: Quality dog bed for indoors or outdoors!! My dogs love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! Love the color and quality. My pups love to sit by our pool and "Chill" and watch us on this bed. The middle section is a very breathable fabric!! Love the bolster option for the sides too!! We are considering another one for our Condo in Hilton Head as well..... we are very satisfied with the easy of assembly and the over all quality and look!! This is the Large bed as we do have two dogs. Other one in the house as he's old and get hot easy lol.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs. One is more independent and the other is one is more of a velcro dog. The independent girl is inclined to lay in the dirt after she has dug the hole just right, so I wasn't sure she would like this bed. But she does! It helps that I put one of their floor pads on it I suppose. I really wanted it so she could have a cool spot in the hot Phoenix summer instead of the dirt. We'll see soon enough!
customer_reviews.author: AZKP

customer_reviews.title: sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't too hard to assemble. The dog uses it but not as often as I would like. She's getting used to it...she'll love it in no time. The bed is study. My 70 lb GDS is hyper and runs and jumps on it when she's excited. Its stood up to her shenanigans so far. I have yet to try to clean it yet and she hasn't tried to chew on it either. So far, so good
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Now so chew proof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dog Kody based on a suggestion from my friend who has the same bed. My dog ate the barrier after 2 months. Every dog is different. I didn’t think he would chew this as he never chewed his padding in his crate. Until he did at 8 months old he seems to love pulling out stuffing. Not sure if there is a way to order the barrier piece separately but he still uses the cot with out it
customer_reviews.author: Ketan Patel

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this bed in a medium size for our rescued Aussiedoodle. I discovered that he likes sleeping on his side with his legs straight out or spread out on his back. The medium size would have been fine if he curled up to sleep. The large size fits his sleeping positions much better. This type bed is also good for dogs that have a lot of fur and need the airflow to keep cooler.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Does it come in human size?!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail today for my large English bulldog. I’m a night shift nurse and he keeps chewing up dog beds while I’m at work. I decided to buy this as it appears to be less easy to destroy. Obviously that has yet to be determined as today is day one of having it home. BUT it was so easy to assemble. He immediately climbed on it and laid down which he never does, he’s usually laying with me, I think this is going to be great. I also bought a soft cover for it as he prefers plush surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: jrubrecht

customer_reviews.title: Pitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and pitty approved. I do wish the bolster sides were machine washable though.
customer_reviews.author: np

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put together, very sturdy and easy to clean. I was afraid this would be too small for my Doberman puppy but she and my 80lb American Bulldog fit on it. I recommend this bed, it's a little more pricey than the others but I think its worth it. They love to destroy the conventional dog bed but I wanted something for them to lay on that had support. So far its lasted longer than a conventional dog bed and I'll be buying another so they can each have one.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Simon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an outdoor enclosure for my cats. It's a perfect size for them. The bolster is separate, so you can leave it off if you like. It is good for my cat who likes to rest her chin in an elevated way. No one has made a mess, yet, but it looks like it will be very easy to clean. This is the second pet product that was made by K&H that I have purchased from Amazon. (The others were the heated beds.) I am impressed enough with these products that I will look for K&H specifically the next time I need some for the cats. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Q.

customer_reviews.title: Dog bed love
customer_reviews.text: Just got the bed dogs seem to love it and keeps them off the floor my bulldog is having an easier time getting up now that he’s not on the hard cold floor o noticed his and back legs are not stiff looking after one whole day of using them bed we are VERY satisfied with the bed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is perfect for my dog. She can prop head on the sides! She is 40 pounds and the large bed gives her plenty of room to stretch out! Very well made nice material -sturdy and easy to clean ! Very comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: My dog didnt like it
customer_reviews.text: I kept hearing how these type of dog beds were favored by most dogs. So I got one for my American Bully puppy. It was super easy to put together. It was also very light but was still durable. The bolster was also easy to get on and off. I did like how the fabric was easy to clean, I just wish it came in other colors. My puppy used it maybe once and never looked at it again. It might be because she is spoiled and use to things that are soft and plush. All in all an ok dog bed just not for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: No sleeping here
customer_reviews.text: While there are a lot of benefits to this bed (metal raised legs, washability, size...), these beds make terribly loud noise any time the dogs move or shift during the night causing us to wake up ourselves! I cannot recommend these beds based solely off this major (and loud) design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki D

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Will make your dog more comfortable on the deck
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great. It’s beautiful and looks more expensive than it really is. It’s very good quality. As you can see from the funny pics, my dog hasn’t quite figured it out yet but I think she’ll warm up to it. It’s seems comfy. I expected rain water to drain thru the mesh, but it pools a bit in the middle and stays wet for a while. But that’s ok. It’s a nice addition to any deck and will ease your dog’s joints when lying outside in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: O. Seidel

customer_reviews.title: Good for a few months, then the bottom falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this bed, and did for about 6 months. Then the bottom started to fray and the seams came apart. My dog is 20 lbs, so he is well within the weight limit! It looks great and seems fine at first, but the durability and quality control sucks. Sorry I can't get my money back or at least a replacement bed liner. Buyer beware with this flimsy product.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: My Husky Loved I!
customer_reviews.text: My husky loved it the day it came in! He loves to try and dig to China while hes on the bed but the material seems extremely tear & chew proof. However, my husky likes the plastic on the corners so he gnawed on it a bit. Regardless, the product is amazing and easy to move or take while camping. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sel Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Perfect outdoor bed
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect outdoor bed to keep your dog off the hot ground. I bought this for my 85 lb lab for the beach and it’s perfect for keeping him off the sand and cool. The bed was very easy to put together, it’s light for travel and sprayed clean easily with the hose. I highly recommend :)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Betcher

customer_reviews.title: GREAT dog bed!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1.5 yr old golden retriever and he LOVES his bed!! He can’t sleep on fluffy pillows because he likes to tear holes in ALL of them, but the only thing he has done with this cot is nibble a small corner but other than that...this cot is built GREAT!! It’s awesome to see my pup resting on this cot and know that he’s not hurting his body sleeping on the hard ground!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product, I have two small dogs and got a Medium and I am sooo happy I did. Reading the reviews it helped me make the best choice. The large would have been too big just go by the measurements if you are unsure, I went by the measurements of their current crate, since they share the crate as well. It’s perfect easy to assemble (my 14yr old son put it together). The material is easy to clean and sturdy but yet comfortable for my 🐕 🐶. I am not sure of the chew proof as my dogs do not have that issue. I would buy again and has already recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: deshonda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog bed!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much I love this dog bed, but my dog loves it even more. He is a 14-year old Australian shepherd in excellent health, but I'm always looking for simple ways to make him happy. This dog bed makes him happy & comfortable. He loves curling up or spreading out while he sleeps. I wondered about picking the right size, but it's just right. He is 38 lbs & 21 inches and has plenty of room. I can't believe how long I bought traditional dog beds that required washing & attracted his fur all day & night. This is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes this bed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this raised bed to get my dog off my bedroom carpet, which had started to mold underneath her fabric dog bed. I have no more mold issues and my dog likes this bed. She even rests her head on the bolsters! The bed is easy to put together and easy to take apart for cleaning. It sags a little in the middle but keeps my dog up off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy fabric
customer_reviews.text: Bolsters are sturdy, the fabric on the base and bolsters is very noisy when the dogs jump on and off. The noisy fabric is annoying, so the bed is in the dog room during the winter and outside during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 2 dogs to use outside. They like to lay on our chaise loungers and I didn't want our cushions getting dirty. I also got the canopy to go along with this bed, they love it! We have it next to the pool so now the dogs can sit outside with us without being in the direct sun! Sturdy construction yet lightweight enough that I can move it around if needed. Can also hose off if it gets dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Jill V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: First of all I gave this 5 stars for chew proof but my dog does not chew things up. I love love love how easy it is to clean. Hair comes right off with a vacuum and looks brand new every time. I bought the medium size and my dog is a 50 lb heeler/Aussie mix. I could have sized down because she likes a smaller bed. If you dog likes to spread out then don’t size down.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed, good price and dog likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for in an outdoor bed. Cool, pretty easy to clean and rain repellent. Oh, and comfy. I ordered the small but wish I had went with medium so he could share with our other, smaller dog. Just enough room for him to fully stretch. He likes it too. Negatives are it’s very light and will blow away and it’s not chew proof.
customer_reviews.author: CollegeKid Mom

customer_reviews.title: Suits the purpose.  Decent price
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yorkie... 7.5 lbs She likes the bed and since our ground freezes it's important that she doesn't sleep on the ground. The biggest problem I have is getting the feet of the bed to sit level on the floor. It's like the material slots for the tubing is skewed. Aside from that problem the bed suits its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Globugg

customer_reviews.title: Best Animal/Pet Purchase Ever
customer_reviews.text: We have two and they are great. Heavy dog and two heavy cats are kept comfortable and enjoy circulation via the mesh cover. Easy to throw in the washer and clean for when there is an accident. I would suggest buying the size larger than you need as all of the animals in the house will decide to lay on "it" rather than lay on their own bed. I know...crazy...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell, so far no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bed for our English Bulldog. She gets on it to check it out yet hasn't quite figured out she can sleep on it. We will let her figure it out. I can't rate it as "chew proof" until we give it some time. So far our pup hasn't attempted. It was very easy to put together. I didn't even look at the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Fox

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this raised bed! We’ve owned it for a few months and it still looks brand new. We added a cushion to make it softer for our dog and she loves it! Since she’s a doxie, we constantly worry about her spine so this is perfect for when we aren’t home but want to ensure that she’s comfortable and not jumping on/off furniture. We are purchasing another one for our son’s rescue Pit.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: For the doggos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the hope that my 80lbs Aussie would sleep on it instead of sleeping on top of me. She does like this bed but still sleeps on my bed. I moved this bed to where my dogs hang out during the day and I can tell she is using it as the netting is not as tight as it was brand new. It was very easy to put together and seems to hold up well! The attachable pillow is really nice too and so far my dogs haven't decided to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Studebaker

customer_reviews.title: Greatest bed ever. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for my senior Chihuahua who can no longer jump easily off my bed. This provides a step where he can land and easily jump down. (He goes up on the bed on his doggie stairs but won't go down them.) In my living room I put this next to my chair for him to cuddle in. I got the medium size because my other dog is bigger and might need it one day. Super easy to put together. Very good quality. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rice

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I did not write a review right away because I wanted to see how the product will last. I ordered this last December 2019 and it is now July 2020 - so far this product is still in good quality. I have a husky and she’s hairy and she’s 70lbs. Everything seems to be in good condition as you can see in my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Bunbunnysmile

customer_reviews.title: Trying to keep the pup off the couch -
customer_reviews.text: It's helping - meaning he still gets to 'climb' on something, get him off the floor. I'll say I expected the actual bed to be more 'firm' - it's just cloth than hangs and gives a little under pressure. We ended up putting another dog bed up on it - (one that doesn't get him up in the air or give him the sides) - works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Medium is the size to get for a larger cat, put a towel at the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and got the medium size. I have a larger older male cat and he can really streach out, and almost touch both ends. He was wondering around the house looking for a place to lay around and just be a cat. I put this together on Friday night, easy assembly, no tools, and I added a 30 x 58 inch bath towel folded in half. The cat stayed on it from the first night on. He likes being up a little bit, so the 7 inches really does the trick. The medium is just right because he can get into any position he wants. I have not washed it yet. Ium
customer_reviews.author: Belrancho 454

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my two dogs (7lb Maltese and 20lb Poodle mix) and they both share it well. It was easy to assemble and I didn't notice any issues with the legs moving or sagging. I brush it clean with a broom and haven't had to hand wash it yet, overall it stays clean. Dogs enjoy it, it keeps them off the ground and provides cool air underneath. A good addition if you're trying to protect your patio furniture. The bolster is the main reason I got it, it does provide support and its well worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy C

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves and highly recommends this bed.
customer_reviews.text: 5 start product. I gave it 5 stars on warmth just because this product proved to be exactly as described and it deserves great ratings. However, I don't think warmth is a describing feature of this product given that because it is a mesh liner and elevated it is supposed to provide airflow and be cool for dogs on hot days. I use blankets for added warmth. During winter I might opt for the self-warming liners, as blankets alone might not cut it. Both me and my dog are happy with this product and would recommend it. FYI - My dog is a 73 lb Weimaraner and I bought the large size - very comfy with plenty of wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Got this in hopes of creating a home base for our shepard dog. When he doesn't know what to do with himself he starts tripping me up as I'm moving about. He took to it immediately. I just say "Place" & he knows what his job is & where to go.....with enthusiasm! Very happy with the quality & price. Will be buying an additional one for our bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Humans & Pups LOVE this bed!
customer_reviews.text: Love this outdoor dog bed! It was so easy to setup, it look me less than 10 minutes. We put it outside on our patio and our pup hopped on instantly. The raised edges seem to make it extra comfortable for him, he can watch birds and what not with ease. We can’t wait to use it camping! Definitley recommend this bed for anyone who likes spending time relaxing with their pet outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: nice little bed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how easy it is to clean because I just got it. Also, my old dog is not a chewer but it looks sturdy if she was. It was not hard to set up. It is not a soft bed so my chihuahua wouldn't use it for over a week until I put a a soft blanket on it for her to snuggle in. Now she uses it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Off the ground Bed
customer_reviews.text: Buddy loves his new bed, we take it in and out of the house as Buddy is getting older we thought this would be better then him just laying on the ground and we were right he loved it. We had one years ago for our other dog and was happy with it. That's all Rusty would lay in. Great product, nicely made. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bough

product_meta.title: K&H PET PRODUCTS Original Bolster Pet Cot Elevated Pet Bed Chocolate
product_meta.description: Size:Small (17" x 22" x 7")| Style:Retail BoxThis could just be the most comfortable pet cot ever made. The super comfortable bolster envelopes and comforts pets for an incredibly relaxing snooze. Utilizing our original best-selling pet cot, the K&H Original Bolster Pet Cot elevated dog bed is sure to please even the pickiest of pets. The bolster is easily removable to quickly convert it into our standard pet cot. The mesh center provides circulation to help pet keep cooler. Holds up to 200 pounds. One year limited warranty. Small (17" x 22") Medium (25" x 32") Large (30" x 42") The K&H Pet Cot line features an Original Pet Cot, Original Bolster Pet Cot, Self-Warming pet Cot, Coolin' Pet Cot, and a small Comfy Pet Cot,. Replacement covers are for available separately and can easily be interchanged to suit your pets needs for each season. An optional K&H Pet Cot Canopy is available to hook onto any K&H Pet Cot to offer additional shade and cooling power for your pets.
feature_bullets: Dog cot made of waterproof, heavy-denier fabric with fluffy plush bolster for ultimate pet comfort and security
Raised dog bed helps pets stay cool with its mesh center
Durable & tested for strength, holds up to 200 pounds
Simple, tool-free assembly with non-skid rubber feet
Great for indoor, outdoor and travel use and includes a one year manufacturer's limited warranty
Small size elevated dog bed measures 17 X 22 X 7 inches
If you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188
